required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healthy and Renal Impairment Study of Colcrys (Colchicine, USP)
clinical_study.official_title: Single-Dose, Open-Label Study of the Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Tolerability of Colcrys (Colchicine, USP) Tablets 0.6 mg Administered to Healthy Subjects and Subjects With Mild, Moderate, Severe Renal Impairment, and End-Stage Renal Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to compare the pharmacokinetic profiles of colchicine and its primary metabolites in plasma and urine following a single 0.6 mg oral dose of colchicine in healthy adults with normal renal function, in patients with mild, moderate or severe renal impairment, and in patients with end-stage renal disease on hemodialysis. An additional objective of this study is to study the clearance of colchicine and its metabolites by hemodialysis. Secondary objectives include evaluation of the safety and tolerability of colchicine in the study population.

detailed_description.textblock: 40 male and female subjects will be enrolled in the study and stratified into one of five groups based on their renal status as determined from creatinine clearance (CrCL) estimated using the serum creatinine (sCR) and the Cockcroft-Gault and Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as follows: Treatment group 1 - healthy adults with normal renal function (CrCL/eGFR> 90 mL/min); Treatment groups 2, 3 and 4 - patients with mild (CrCL/eGFR 60-89 mL/min), moderate (CrCL/eGFR 30 to 59 mL/min), and severe (CrCL/eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min) renal impairment, respectively; and Treatment group 5 - subjects with end-stage renal disease requiring hemodialysis. On study day 1, participants in Treatment Groups 1 to 4 will be administered one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet at 8 a.m. under standard fasting conditions. Blood samples will be collected from all participants before dosing and both blood and urine samples will be collected for 120 hours post-dose on a confined basis at times sufficient to adequately define the pharmacokinetics of colchicine and its primary metabolites. There will be two study periods for treatment group 5; Period 1 off dialysis and Period 2 on dialysis with a 14 day washout period between the two study periods. On study day 1, participants in treatment group 5 will be administered one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet under standard fasting conditions immediately following dialysis. Blood samples will be collected from all participants before dosing and for up to 70 hours post-dose at times sufficient to adequately determine the pharmacokinetics of colchicine and its primary metabolites. All adverse events will be evaluated by the investigator and reported in the participant's case report form.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: The maximum or peak concentration of colchicine in the plasma.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: The time to reach the maximum or peak concentration of colchicine in the plasma.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration Time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of Last Measured Concentration (AUC 0-t)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (ESRD patients only), predose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, and 120 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration versus time curve beginning from the first dose until the last quantifiable concentration, calculated by the linear trapezoidal method.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration Time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC 0 - ∞)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration versus time curve extrapolated to infinity. AUC 0 - ∞ is calculated as the sum of total AUC 0-t plus the ratio of the last measurable plasma concentration to the elimination rate constant.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent First-order Terminal Elimination Rate Constant (Kel)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: Apparent first-order terminal elimination rate constant calculated from a semi-log plot of the plasma concentration versus time curve for colchicine. The parameter was calculated by linear least-squares regression analysis using the maximum number of points in the terminal log-linear phase (e.g., three or more non-zero plasma concentrations).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The apparent first-order terminal elimination half-life was calculated as 0.693/Kel.

primary_outcome.measure: The Apparent Total Volume of Distribution After Administration (V-area/F)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The apparent total volume of distribution after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose / (AUC0-∞ × Kel).

primary_outcome.measure: Weight-adjusted Apparent Total Volume of Distribution After Administration (V-area/F)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The apparent total volume of distribution after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose / (AUC0-∞ × Kel), and normalized to body weight.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Body Clearance of Colchicine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The apparent total body clearance after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose/AUC(0-∞).

primary_outcome.measure: Weight-adjusted Apparent Total Body Clearance of Colchicine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The apparent total body clearance after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose/AUC(0-∞) and normalized to body weight (in kilograms).

primary_outcome.measure: Amount of Colchicine Excreted in Urine (Ae[0-t])
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1 and up to 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The amount of colchicine excreted in urine during the post-dose collection, calculated as the sum of the amounts in the individual collection intervals (Ae).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Colchicine Dose Excreted in Urine up to the Final Collection Time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1 and up to 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: The cumulative percentage of the colchicine dose excreted in urine up to the final collection time, calculated as Ae(0-t) × 100/dose

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1 and up to 120 hours post dose.
primary_outcome.description: Renal clearance of colchicine, calculated as Ae(0 t)/AUC 0-t.
The dialysis clearance of colchicine, calculated as amount of colchicine recovered in dialysate / AUCt2-t1 where t1 and t2 are the times of the start and end of hemodialysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Colchicine Dose Recovered in Dialysate
primary_outcome.description: The cumulative percentage of the colchicine dose recovered in dialysate.

arm_group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (Creatinine Clearance [CrCl] ≥90 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.
Participants with mild renal impairment (estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate [eGFR] 60 to 89 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.
Participants with moderate renal impairment (CrCl/eGFR 30 to 59 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.
Participants with severe renal impairment (eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1 immediately following dialysis. After a 14-day washout, participants received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult males and females 18-70 years old with a body mass index of <39 kg/m^2.
- Patients with normal renal function or mild renal impairment should be generally healthy on the basis of medical history and physical exam.
- Patients with moderate to end stage renal impairment should be generally medically healthy other than with respect to the morbidities associated with impaired renal function.
- Non-pregnant (post-menopausal, surgically sterile or using effective contraceptive measures).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to colchicine or any component of the formulation of the study drug.
- Patients with a history or presence of a significant medical condition that would interfere with interpretation of the study results.
- Patients who have used any drugs or substances known to inhibit or induce cytochrome P450 (CYP) enzymes and/or P-glycoprotein within 28 days prior to the first dose and throughout the study.
- Patients with recent (2 year) history or evidence of alcoholism or drug abuse or significant psychiatric disease.
- Patients with chronic hepatic dysfunction.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants took part in the study at three investigative sites in the United States from 25 May 2010 to 28 February 2011.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Healthy participants, participants with mild, moderate or severe renal impairment and participants with end stage renal disease (requiring hemodialysis) were stratified to one of five treatment groups based on their renal status. All participants received 0.6 mg colchicine.

group.title: Healthy
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (Creatinine Clearance [CrCl] ≥90 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild renal impairment (estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate [eGFR] 60 to 89 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Moderate
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment CrCl/eGFR 30 to 59 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Severe
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment (eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: ESRD
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1 immediately following dialysis. After a 14-day washout, participants received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

group.title: ESRD
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1 immediately following dialysis. After a 14-day washout, participants received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

class.title: Native Hawaiian or other pacific islander

measure.title: Child Bearing Potential
measure.description: Counts are based on the number of female participants.

measure.title: Creatinine Clearance/estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate
measure.description: Creatinine Clearance for Healthy Treatment Group and estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate for Mild, Moderate, Severe and ESRD Treatment Groups.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
outcome.description: The maximum or peak concentration of colchicine in the plasma.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose
outcome.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet taken on study day 1 immediately following dialysis.

group.title: ESRD - on Dialysis
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

outcome.title: Apparent Total Body Clearance of Colchicine
outcome.description: The apparent total body clearance after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose/AUC(0-∞).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
outcome.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

group.title: Healthy
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Moderate
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Severe
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: ESRD - Off Dialysis
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet taken on study day 1 immediately following dialysis.

group.title: ESRD - on Dialysis
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

measure.title: Apparent Total Body Clearance of Colchicine
measure.description: The apparent total body clearance after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose/AUC(0-∞).
measure.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

outcome.title: Weight-adjusted Apparent Total Body Clearance of Colchicine
outcome.description: The apparent total body clearance after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose/AUC(0-∞) and normalized to body weight (in kilograms).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 15 (for ESRD patients only) pre-dose and at 0.5, 1, 1.5 , 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post dose.
outcome.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet taken on study day 1 immediately following dialysis.

group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

measure.title: Weight-adjusted Apparent Total Body Clearance of Colchicine
measure.description: The apparent total body clearance after administration of colchicine, calculated as Dose/AUC(0-∞) and normalized to body weight (in kilograms).
measure.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

outcome.title: Amount of Colchicine Excreted in Urine (Ae[0-t])
outcome.description: The amount of colchicine excreted in urine during the post-dose collection, calculated as the sum of the amounts in the individual collection intervals (Ae).
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1 and up to 120 hours post dose.
outcome.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

group.title: Healthy
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Moderate
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Severe
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

measure.title: Amount of Colchicine Excreted in Urine (Ae[0-t])
measure.description: The amount of colchicine excreted in urine during the post-dose collection, calculated as the sum of the amounts in the individual collection intervals (Ae).
measure.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Colchicine Dose Excreted in Urine up to the Final Collection Time
outcome.description: The cumulative percentage of the colchicine dose excreted in urine up to the final collection time, calculated as Ae(0-t) × 100/dose
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1 and up to 120 hours post dose.
outcome.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

group.title: Healthy
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Moderate
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Severe
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

measure.title: Percentage of Colchicine Dose Excreted in Urine up to the Final Collection Time
measure.description: The cumulative percentage of the colchicine dose excreted in urine up to the final collection time, calculated as Ae(0-t) × 100/dose
measure.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

outcome.title: Renal Clearance of Colchicine (CLR)
outcome.description: Renal clearance of colchicine, calculated as Ae(0 t)/AUC 0-t.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1 and up to 120 hours post dose.
outcome.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

group.title: Healthy
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Moderate
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Severe
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

measure.title: Renal Clearance of Colchicine (CLR)
measure.description: Renal clearance of colchicine, calculated as Ae(0 t)/AUC 0-t.
measure.population: Per Protocol Analysis Population - Participants renal function was characterized by CrCl using the Cockcroft-Gault equation as healthy (≥90 mL/min), and characterized by Modified Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) equations as mild (60 - 89 mL/min), moderate (30 - 59 mL/min), severe (15 - 29 mL/min), and ESRD patients requiring dialysis.

outcome.title: Dialysis Clearance of Colchicine (CLD)
outcome.description: The dialysis clearance of colchicine, calculated as amount of colchicine recovered in dialysate / AUCt2-t1 where t1 and t2 are the times of the start and end of hemodialysis.
outcome.population: ESRD participants on dialysis, where data were available.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD)
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet taken under standard fasting conditions on study day 1 immediately following dialysis. After a 14-day washout, participants received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

measure.title: Dialysis Clearance of Colchicine (CLD)
measure.description: The dialysis clearance of colchicine, calculated as amount of colchicine recovered in dialysate / AUCt2-t1 where t1 and t2 are the times of the start and end of hemodialysis.
measure.population: ESRD participants on dialysis, where data were available.

outcome.title: Percentage of Colchicine Dose Recovered in Dialysate
outcome.description: The cumulative percentage of the colchicine dose recovered in dialysate.
outcome.population: ESRD participants on dialysis, where data were available.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD)
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet taken under standard fasting conditions on study day 1 immediately following dialysis. After a 14-day washout, participants received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

measure.title: Percentage of Colchicine Dose Recovered in Dialysate
measure.description: The cumulative percentage of the colchicine dose recovered in dialysate.
measure.population: ESRD participants on dialysis, where data were available.

reported_events.time_frame: From the first dose of study drug up to 6 days.
reported_events.desc: The investigator documented any occurrence of adverse events and abnormal laboratory findings. Any event spontaneously reported by the participant or observed by the investigator was recorded, irrespective of the relation to study treatment.

group.title: Healthy
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (Creatinine Clearance [CrCl] ≥90 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild renal impairment (estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate [eGFR] 60 to 89 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Moderate
group.description: Participants with moderate renal impairment CrCl/eGFR 30 to 59 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: Severe
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment (eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1.

group.title: ESRD
group.description: Participants with end stage renal disease (ESRD) received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on study day 1 immediately following dialysis. After a 14-day washout, participants received one colchicine 0.6 mg tablet on Day 15 prior to dialysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: No publication related to study results will be made without Sponsor’s prior written approval. Any proposed publication or presentation will be submitted to Sponsor for review 60 days in advance of publication. Institution will remove Sponsor confidential information unrelated to study results. Sponsor can delay a proposed publication for an additional 60 days to preserve intellectual property.

point_of_contact.organization: Takeda Global Research and Development Center, Inc.
